definition: batik (color printing on cloth using wax)
to dye/to catch (a disease)/to acquire (bad habits etc)/to contaminate/to add color washes to a painting

sentences.english: At present various wax printing works have already been the fad that both chinese and foreign visitors run after .
sentences.chinese: 目前各种蜡染艺术品已是中外游客追求的时尚。

sentences.english: Update a tie-dye dress with hardware jewelry and rugged boots.
sentences.chinese: 一条蜡染的长裙与重金属首饰和粗犷皮靴的搭配。

sentences.english: As a special flower of national art, wax printing is rich in national characteristic.
sentences.chinese: 蜡染是具有独特风格的民族艺术之花，富有民族特色。

sentences.english: Batik is a kind of fabric that is produced using a wax-resist dyeing technique.
sentences.chinese: 蜡染是一种运用蜡防染色技术生产的织品。

sentences.english: In the Han Dynasty, the viewing of batik has begun to appear.
sentences.chinese: 而在汉代，观赏性的蜡染已开始出现了。

definition: Hunan embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
woven palm fiber (used in handicraft)/coir/woven coconut fiber
Hmong or Miao ethnic group of southwest China
papercutting (Chinese folk art)/to make paper cutouts
Suzhou embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
